title: Mexico Resumes Exports of Avocados to U.S.
sub_head: Suspension lifted as Mexico takes measures to ensure safety of U.S. inspectors
body:
MEXICO CITY—The U.S. resumed inspections and imports of Mexican avocados that were suspended a week ago after an U.S. inspector in the principal producing state of Michoacán received a threatening phone call.
The Agriculture Department’s Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service said Friday that inspections have restarted and exports resumed with Mexico taking measures to enhance the safety of its inspectors in Michoacán.
